reviewText: Both movies are OK to watch. If you check other movie review sites, you'll see they also give these 2 flicks a so so rating.  I think that's fair.  I just want to comment on the quality of the Blu-ray.  Both movies have very good video and audio quality (DTS).  So, that's pretty good.  Some of the older movies that were converted to Blu-ray were done so in name only when their video and audio quality were just on par with DVD.
Title: Two-Movie Collection: Firefox / Heartbreak Ridge

reviewText: Love the movies, but the transfers feel like a basic upscale rather than new transfers to the higher resolution, which are getting annoying with many older Blu-ray movies, especially as we move to the newer much higher 4K resolutions, it will only get exacerbated.
Title: Two-Movie Collection: Firefox / Heartbreak Ridge

reviewText: Down to earth, great drama. Clint Eastwood is fantastic in his gritty, natural talented way! He never fails to amaze me.
Title: Two-Movie Collection: Firefox / Heartbreak Ridge

reviewText: Please describe the audio and video quality of any Blu-Ray you review.  Thanks to those who do this.Both movies have DTS-HD Master Audio 5.1 soundtracks, which are very good.Video quality varied throughout the movies.  Firefox started out very good, and had a lot of very good parts, but some parts were grainy.  The flying scenes at the end were, unfortunately, grainy.  Heartbreak Ridge also had some very good parts, and some grainy parts.  Video quality in these two movies wasn't great, but mostly good.Overall, these are pretty good movies, and I'm not terribly disappointed with the video quality.  I'm satisfied with this purchase.
summary: Mixed Video Quality / Very Good Audio
Title: Two-Movie Collection: Firefox / Heartbreak Ridge

reviewText: If you like Clint Eastwood, you have to see both these films.  They are very different from each other, for sure.Firefox concerns stealing the ultimate flying machine from the Russian commies, and Heartbreak Ridge is about an old CMOH gunnery sergeant who trains a platoon and takes them to war in Grenada... and teaches them to be men.  Yes, there are lots of laughs along the way as well.  What until you see the size of the human mountain who shows up to teach the sergeant a lesson!
Title: Two-Movie Collection: Firefox / Heartbreak Ridge

reviewText: FireFox is a great action movie...worth the money. Heartbreak Ridge, on the other hand, seemed..well..a little amateurish. It's like the characters were trying to hard to act and you could tell it. The only reason I bought these disks was...Clint Eastwood.
Title: Two-Movie Collection: Firefox / Heartbreak Ridge

reviewText: For a taste of the Cold War at its height (and near its conclusion), Firefox is a great blast from the past.  They tried hard in the film to highlight all sorts of elements of the Soviet apparatus, including dissident scientists, Jews who were downtrodden and oppressed by the system, bureaucrats mindlessly following orders, the vastness of the country, and the intransigence of the pre-Gorbachev leadership.  The Soviet leader portrayed here is a kind of Breshnev-meets-Andropov figure, who is hoping for a technological leap above the Western powers.  This film also taps into the then-prevalent Western fears that the Soviets would make some kind of technological breakthrough that would tip the balance of power inexorably in their favour; of course, time would reveal that they were much more worried about our technological and economic advances with which they could never really compete.  But that's too complex for a film like this, which is already a spy-thriller, chase, and military adventure film rolled into one.  It succeeds for the most part on these levels - Clint Eastwood plays the still-having-flashbacks pilot drafted into the mission of stealing the new MIG-31, a plane so technologically advanced it can operate on mental commands, but limited enough that it would only recognise them in Russian (Eastwood played a pilot fluent in Russian).In a somewhat strange role, Nigel Hawthorne (one of my all-time favourite actors) played the key Russian scientist, reluctantly but effectively developing the technology, but just as effectively determined to help it be stolen.  Many of the other actors are British, including those playing Russians and those playing Americans.  All are reasonably effective, though there are few stellar performances here.The special effects are very good - John Dykstra of Star Wars fame produced many of the elements in this.  Scenes of flying in the cockpit and the dogfights between the planes are very effective; they were more dramatic, in all honesty, before Top Gun came along, but they remain rather good even in comparison.In all, this is an interesting film, a bit overlooked now because time has moved on past the subject matter.  It is one of the earlier films produced and directed by Clint Eastwood, who has gone on to much bigger and grander projects, but one can see his touch here.For the second film in this package, one also gets a later Cold War scenario, this time in the tropics rather than the frozen Siberian arctic.  Eastwood plays a tough-as-nails, no nonsense Gunny who has to whip a sadsack platoon of misfits into fighting Marines.  Good thing he's a Medal of Honor winner, something that irks his desk-bound, procurement specialist commander to no end.  There are lots of stereotypes here - no complete Gomer Pyles, but several close seconds.  Of course, the administrator/commander is against everything the Gunny wants to do, but the wiser general in the end saves the day for Gunny, as he and his platoon save the day for students trapped on the Caribbean island as Cubans try to take over.  And the film ends with a rousing parade, unlike the return from Vietnam.On the whole, two good killing-time films; far from great fare, but entertaining, especially for those who like a military theme (friends of mine in the USMC particularly like to sit and pick out the technical problems with Heartbreak Ridge!).
Title: Two-Movie Collection: Firefox / Heartbreak Ridge

reviewText: I have not had the opportunity to watch either movie because of a stupid problem with my right foot. If the movie Hrartbreak Ridge is the same as the one I have seen before, I should enjoy the movie.
Title: Two-Movie Collection: Firefox / Heartbreak Ridge

reviewText: First let me say that I don't like the 'Foxfire'.  It may be just me but I have trouble believing Clint as a fighter pilot.The other half of the double feature however makes it all worthwhile.  Clint is totally believable in the part of an aging, hard drinking Gunnery Sergeant who because he says it like it is and does what's necessary has become political incorrect.  He has been sidelined by his new commande to supervise the misits in his Recon Platoon, whom the commander regularly uses to make the Headquaters Platoon look good.
Title: Two-Movie Collection: Firefox / Heartbreak Ridge

reviewText: Clint Eastwood plays tough like no other in both FIREFOX and HEARTBREAK RIDGE. Nice deal on 2 movies in one package.
Title: Two-Movie Collection: Firefox / Heartbreak Ridge

reviewText: The movie "Firefox" alone is worth the price. It has whatever you like; thrills, action, suspense, intrigue - the whole enchilada. It qualifies as one of my "best." Having the second film is icing on the cake. "Heartbreak Ridge" is not as good but it holds up and is worth watching. If you are an Eastwood fan, this is whoopee time.
Title: Two-Movie Collection: Firefox / Heartbreak Ridge

reviewText: I had previously seen both movies, but not in blu-ray."Firefox" is about a plot for an ex-Air Force pilot to steal the latest Russian fighter. The beginning portion of the movie took too long, and not enough time was used for the actual theft of the plane. Regardless of my opinion, it was an exciting movie with good special effects.The blu-ray color definitely enhanced the enjoyability of the movie."Heartbreak Ridge", is a story about a veteran Marine assigned to a bunch of marine misfits in a "Recon" squadron. Eastwood plays the role of a Gunnery Sergeant, whose job was to shape up the misfits into a combat ready platoon.It was interesting watching the development of the unit, were assigned to combat. Again, the color of the blu-ray edition enhanced the pleasure of the movie.I would recommend this order to those who enjoy Clint Eastwood action movies!JTB
Title: Two-Movie Collection: Firefox / Heartbreak Ridge

reviewText: I'm a huge Clint Eastwood fan and have been collecting his movies on BluRay.  This disc makes a very convenient and inexpensive way of getting two movies for the price of one.
Title: Two-Movie Collection: Firefox / Heartbreak Ridge

reviewText: Two spectacular films of one of my favorite actors Clint Eastwood, who has become an icon of film in the genre of spaghetti wester and action as Dirty Harry.
Title: Two-Movie Collection: Firefox / Heartbreak Ridge

reviewText: I haven't watched the Heartbreak Ridge disc yet but Firefox has never looked or sounded better.  It's not reference quality by any stretch but it is a significant improvement over the DVD in every respect. Firefox is a great movie, btw.
Title: Two-Movie Collection: Firefox / Heartbreak Ridge

reviewText: Two  separate "clint" blu ray DVDs for tiny money... ? It doesn't get any better ..five stars on this one.Thank you!
Title: Two-Movie Collection: Firefox / Heartbreak Ridge

reviewText: I got an email about "Firefox" being on blu-ray and was pleasantly surprised.  I had to get it as a gift for my "Firefox" fan.  He already has the DVD and LOVED the upgraded picture quality in this Blu-ray. This disc arrived earlier than promised and was in great shape.
Title: Two-Movie Collection: Firefox / Heartbreak Ridge

reviewText: Let it be said that I am pretty sure the "problem" with the grainy video sequences on these films is a matter of what type of film was used, but don't know that for sure. Either way, there's not a ton of detail to be seen in either Firefox or Heartbreak Ridge. This is probably the best they've ever looked, but you can tell they received very little, if any, loving from Warner on this release.Video:1080p video on both. VC-1 encoded.As already stated, video is somewhat muddied in both releases and at times you may be "lucky" enough to see some macro blocking in the shadows.Warner should have done better.Audio:This is the place these releases shine. Both get 5.1 DTS MA tracks and while they aren't bass thumping, rock the house, they are superbly mixed.Extras:Extras? What extras? I guess theatrical trailers count, too bad that's about all there is.Overall:If you like either film, pick up this 2 pack. Both are worthy of being watched and given the 2 pack is cheaper (at the moment) than buying both separately (and only $2-$3 more than either), it's worth it.If you're looking for a pillar of Blu Ray releases, these discs are not what you're looking for.Recommended if you are fan of either film. If not, might be better to skip this 2 disc set and the single releases as well.
summary: OK video quality, great audio quality
Title: Two-Movie Collection: Firefox / Heartbreak Ridge

reviewText: As for the Firefox movie it's a great movie and so is Heartbreak Ridge.  It's better quality over the old copy I have and as for the sound well let's just say it's not really 5.1DDS.  It's better than the original 2chnl dvd with better picture quality.  So yes it is better..!  If your that much of a stickler for sound and picture quality then don't buy this.  But if you want better than vhs or old dvd then buy it and I bet you'll like it over the old original old stuff.I love these movies and Firefox was a great movie and still is..
Title: Two-Movie Collection: Firefox / Heartbreak Ridge

reviewText: Two of Clint's military efforts that use his demeanor to solid results. Is awesome as the Gunny who gets his less than motivated platoon into shape, and solid again as the retired pilot brought in to steal Russia's best airplane.
Title: Two-Movie Collection: Firefox / Heartbreak Ridge

reviewText: Firefox with it's awful special effects deserves a remake or at least a pass with today's special effects, but holds up as a great Cloak and Dagger flick full of sacrifice and intrigue that climatically ends in dog fight. There are some very cool moments in this film although I could have done without the flash backs.Heartbreak Ridge is a campy Full Metal Jacket that doesn't even deserve that comparison.  Eastwood plays a gunnery sargent that has to adjust to the changes in his beloved marine core and take on one last fight with this new platoon.
summary: These two movies captured my imagination growing up
Title: Two-Movie Collection: Firefox / Heartbreak Ridge

reviewText: Another Clint Eastwood classic.Must for every fan of his movies.2-in-1 combo in best cheap form..-- Viraf P Chinoy
Title: Two-Movie Collection: Firefox / Heartbreak Ridge

reviewText: Fire Fox has always been a favorite with me.  Other reviewers have gone into the details of the movies so won't. I have read both the Firefox books and I am only sorry that they did not make the second book onto a movie.  It completes getting the Firefox back home and is more exciting than the first book.  Let's just say the dogfight at the end of the first movie wounded the Firefox and as it flies away there is a vapor trail behind it.  It can't make it back home.  Nuff said, get the book it is great.Heartbreak Ridge is another good one for Eastwood.  The old Marine, set in his way, getting it done and staying alive.  I like this one also.I have seen other copies of both films and the Blu-ray copies of Firefox and Heartbreak Ridge are wonderful.
Title: Two-Movie Collection: Firefox / Heartbreak Ridge
